item.description:
Meet: 11am @ parking lot, 16 Poole Road
Admission: $4 for adults, $2 for children
Hike: 11:15am up and down White Dot (or maybe White Dot up, White Cross down)

Please bring lunch, plenty to drink, sunscreen, bug spray, and a raincoat. (Although if any kind of steady, even light, rain is predicted at all, this hike will be cancelled. The rocks are slippery and dangerous when wet.) Please check before leaving the house in case this hike is cancelled/rescheduled due to bad weather!

Trail details:

One popular hike is to take the White Dot Trail up and go down the White Cross. They are mostly parallel and similar. In the higher parts, the White Dot has a few steeper parts with rests between, and the White Cross is a little less steep but no rests. I will leave these choices up to the group, because I have never been to Monadnock myself:

  1. Up the White Dot, down the White Cross.
  2. Up and down the White Cross only.

These trails are extremely popular, but less crowded during the week. You can read about them here:
http://www.qcc.mass.edu/brink/Trav-rec/mt_monad/mmwhite.html

This is the official Mount Monadnock website:
http://www.nhstateparks.org/explore/state-parks/monadnock-state-park.aspx

Need to carpool?

Agree on a location with another member, and *if you want to make it public*, post a comment! (Then I can add it below.)

  1. Leave @ 10:45am from Walmart, 750 U.S. Highway 202, Rindge, NH 03461. (I will get there about 10:30.) Map: http://maps.google.com/maps/place?cid=15405041253140819878&q=walmart,+750+us+highway+202,&hl=en&ved=0CBAQ-gswAA&sa=X&ei=DL1qTuPOBIniywTwrNH-Aw
item.how_to_find_us: Hike @ 11:15am from parking lot @ 16 Poole Rd, Jaffrey, NH.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Weekday Hike: Mount Monadnock
